intro: Scabiosa tomentosa f. longiaristata, commonly known as the woolly scabious or long-stalked scabious, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and clusters of small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its unique appearance and long flowering period make it a valuable addition to botanical gardens and wildflower habitats.
